definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to vilify sb wantonly/unrestrained attack (on sb)

sentences.english: All it's doing is hyping everyone up.
sentences.chinese: “所有它的做法是每個人都大肆宣揚了”。

sentences.english: Then there is the much-ballyhooed but ultimately disproved link to vaccines.
sentences.chinese: 接着又一些大肆報道，但最後證實與疫苗有關。

sentences.english: Since then, the Japanese have been instrumental in nearly wiping out the Western grey whale population.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，日本人開始大肆捕鯨，西部灰鯨幾近滅亡。

sentences.english: The more underhanded gambit is the decision to bash the insurance industry at every turn.
sentences.chinese: 政府的另一狠招是對於保險業的大肆抨擊。

sentences.english: they proclaimed. They rebelled against everything and wreaked havoc everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 他們宣稱“造反有理”，反對一切並大肆毀滅破壞。

sentences.english: We actually open the site to the public.
You just hate waste, and when someone else costs you dearly you see red.
sentences.chinese: 你厭惡浪費，如果別人讓你大肆破費，你會發怒。

sentences.english: Huang association army with silver and food do bait aggressively recruiting.
sentences.chinese: 皇協軍以銀元和食物做誘餌大肆招兵。

sentences.english: The papers are playing up the oil crises again.
sentences.chinese: 各報又在大肆渲染石油危機了。

sentences.english: He started squandering and squandered with such spirit, that all his worldly wealth was I. O. U.
sentences.chinese: 他開始大肆揮霍，直到所有的財富都成了欠條。

sentences.english: Finally, one day a wolf really came and began to kill the sheep.
sentences.chinese: 終於有一天，狼真的來了，竄入羊羣，大肆咬殺。

sentences.english: Among them relatively typical token, be " Martian article " use wantonly .
sentences.chinese: 其中較爲典型的表徵，是“火星文”的大肆使用。

sentences.english: He devoted much of his talk to plugging for the party candidate.
sentences.chinese: 他大量演講，大肆爲這位黨的候選人做宣傳。

sentences.english: A humdinger of a tale about the animal is often a clue that this is a wine to avoid.
sentences.chinese: 對動物的大肆渲染，往往是提示我們不要買這樣的酒。

sentences.english: The Vikings raped and pillaged all along the coast.
sentences.chinese: 北歐海盜沿着海岸大肆姦淫劫掠。

definition: to vilify sb wantonly/unrestrained attack (on sb)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to proclaim/to make public or well known
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
